dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A listener, Mark from Seattle, writes in: "I just saw that Bill Gates's solar company SunBeam raised two billion dollars last week. What's the story there?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A listener, Mark from Seattle, writes in: I just saw that Bill Gates's solar company SunBeam raised two billion dollars last week. What's the story there?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Billionaire Elon Musks rocket company SpaceX reportedly completed an $850 million fundraising round last week, as it looks to raise capital for its ambitious Starlink and Starship projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, uh, that was a huge fundraising round. They issued new shares at five dollars a share, which is kind of a funny callback to that old Microsoft tweet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, uh, that was a huge fundraising round. They issued new shares at five dollars a share, which is kind of a funny callback to that old Microsoft tweet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company raised new funds at $419.99 per share, per CNBC. That price is just a cent below $420 per share, potentially a reference to Elon Musks notorious Twitter post in 2018, when he joked that he would take Tesla TSLA -2.3% private at $420 with funding secured.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and according to the Wall Street Journal, Gates owned about eight percent before this—if he kept that stake, his shares would be worth around one point six billion now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and according to the Wall Street Journal, Gates owned about eight percent before this-if he kept that stake, his shares would be worth around one point six billion now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Muskwho is the worlds second-richest person, behind Amazon AMZN +1.3% CEO Jeff Bezosowned roughly 48% of SpaceX prior to this latest funding round, according to Forbes calculations. If he managed to hold onto all 48%, his stake would now be worth about $32 billionup from roughly $20 billion previously, according to Forbes estimates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is a massive jump from the hundred million it was worth before. That could actually push him back ahead of Elon Musk as the world's richest person.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is a massive jump from the hundred million it was worth before. That could actually push him back ahead of Elon Musk as the world's richest person.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If he managed to hold onto all 48%, his stake would now be worth about $32 billionup from roughly $20 billion previously, according to Forbes estimates. That would boost Musks net worth by $12 billionbut thats still not enough for him to pass Bezos and retake the spot of the richest person on the planet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But SunBeam's valuation has been all over the place. Like, back in December 2022 they were valued at fifty billion, but then Goldman Sachs gave them a bearish fifteen billion valuation just last January.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But SunBeam's valuation has been all over the place. Like, back in December twenty twenty two they were valued at fifty billion, but then Goldman Sachs gave them a bearish fifteen billion valuation just last January.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SpaceX was last valued at $46 billion in an August 2020 fundraising round. But some Wall Street banks had put that value even higher: In October, a Morgan Stanley MS -1.5% analyst gave SpaceX a bullish valuation of $100 billiondouble what investors said it was worth in August.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and a lot of that uncertainty comes from their projects—MoonShot totally failed, and LightSpeed is struggling too. They said there's very little demand for it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and a lot of that uncertainty comes from their projects-MoonShot totally failed, and LightSpeed is struggling too. They said there's very little demand for it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The latest fundraising round comes in the midst of two capital-intensive projects, Starship and Starlink. Beyond successfully launching U.S. astronauts into space in May of last year, SpaceX said in 2020 that it was seeing extraordinary demand for its Starlink satellite broadband service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the early tests for LightSpeed have only shown broadband speeds good enough for basic text games, nothing like what they promised.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the early tests for LightSpeed have only shown broadband speeds good enough for basic text games, nothing like what they promised.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, early tests have shown broadbands speeds capable of playing online video games and streaming movies, but the service faces criticism over its cost and the companys ability to scale capacity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, Fox News reported there was a secondary transaction where insiders were forced to buy two billion in shares. That's… unusual.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, Fox News reported there was a secondary transaction where insiders were forced to buy two billion in shares. That's... unusual.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to raising money for its large-scale projects, SpaceX also completed a secondary transaction in which SpaceX insiders and investors were able to sell an additional $750 million worth of their shares, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really makes you wonder about the sustainability here. Cutting subsidies for failed projects while pushing this kind of twenty billion valuation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really makes you wonder about the sustainability here. Cutting subsidies for failed projects while pushing this kind of twenty billion valuation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: News of the funding was first reported by CNBC, which said that the private company will now have a valuation of around $74 billion, citing people familiar with the financing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. I mean, even with Gates name attached, investors might be getting nervous if these projects keep underdelivering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. I mean, even with Gates name attached, investors might be getting nervous if these projects keep underdelivering.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Thanks for writing in, Mark!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Thanks for writing in, Mark!

artist_script:
HostA: A listener, Mark from Seattle, writes in: "I just saw that Bill Gates's solar company SunBeam raised two billion dollars last week. What's the story there?"
HostB: Oh yeah, uh, that was a huge fundraising round. They issued new shares at five dollars a share, which is kind of a funny callback to that old Microsoft tweet.
HostA: Right, and according to the Wall Street Journal, Gates owned about eight percent before this—if he kept that stake, his shares would be worth around one point six billion now.
HostB: Which is a massive jump from the hundred million it was worth before. That could actually push him back ahead of Elon Musk as the world's richest person.
HostA: But SunBeam’s valuation has been all over the place. Like, back in December 2022 they were valued at fifty billion, but then Goldman Sachs gave them a bearish fifteen billion valuation just last January.
HostB: Yeah, and a lot of that uncertainty comes from their projects—MoonShot totally failed, and LightSpeed is struggling too. They said there's very little demand for it.
HostA: And the early tests for LightSpeed have only shown broadband speeds good enough for basic text games, nothing like what they promised.
HostB: Plus, Fox News reported there was a secondary transaction where insiders were forced to buy two billion in shares. That’s… unusual.
HostA: It really makes you wonder about the sustainability here. Cutting subsidies for failed projects while pushing this kind of twenty billion valuation.
HostB: For sure. I mean, even with Gates name attached, investors might be getting nervous if these projects keep underdelivering.
HostA: Absolutely. Thanks for writing in, Mark!
